definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: I can't wait to visit Fuping again to see the new museums and all the new work in the museums.
sentences.chinese: 我急不可待的想再次看到新馆群和其所馆藏的新作品。

sentences.english: I can hardly wait to see the new comet.
sentences.chinese: 我急不可待地要见到新彗星的出现。

sentences.english: They're chomping at the bit to get their tomatoes in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 他们急不可待地想在菜园里采摘西红柿。

sentences.english: He is bursting to tell you the news.
sentences.chinese: 他急不可待地要把消息告诉你。

sentences.english: Jiajia couldn't wait to show off his new car to his friends.
sentences.chinese: 佳佳急不可待的在朋友面前炫耀他的新车。

sentences.english: She was bursting to announce the news but was sworn to secrecy .
sentences.chinese: 她急不可待想宣布这个消息，但却发过誓要守口如瓶。

sentences.english: The mother couldn't wait to see her long-lost son.
sentences.chinese: 母亲急不可待地要见她失散多年的儿子。

sentences.english: Jack hurries back to the drugstore, eager to check the results.
sentences.chinese: 杰克急不可待的跑回药店想要看看结果。

sentences.english: Why might balsam be described as impatient?
sentences.chinese: 为什么说凤仙花“急不可待”？

sentences.english: Write your story when you begin to feel its insistent pulse.
sentences.chinese: 当你开始感到小说急不可待的脉动时，就动笔写作。

definition: to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
impatient/to be in a rush (to do sth)/anxious/fretful/agitated
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
to be unable to hold back
regardless of the consequences/recklessly relying on a hopelessly optimistic forecast
pinyin: bu4 guan3 san1 qi1 er4 shi2 yi1
